instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan
threads.message: Got this board here completely dead with a little corrosion around <CAPACITOR>C5010</CAPACITOR>, which mad the trace between it and the pad passing through SMC to evaporate. I ran a wire to rebuild the trace and now the board has green light but only quarter fan and dies, no loop, just a single spin and dies until I remove power and reconnect and it does the same. Already verified classic sensors such as battery sensing circuit, <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>(even replaced it because diode mode on some pins were a bit strange and normalized after replacing) and verified PBUS sensors which are classic on this board to die too. Still no luck. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C5626</CAPACITOR> was a little corroded and that's why it was having quarter fan. Solved
